Title: Discussion
Abstract: © 2018, The Author(s).This chapter draws together various components by, firstly, reiterating the context and purpose of the study. It then discusses how Islamic religious beliefs regarding sexual activity outside marriage, Men who have Sex with Men and transgender women affect HIV prevention policy. It triangulates the findings using both the qualitative and quantitative components to understand stakeholders’ knowledge of and views about HIV transmission and prevention.
AuthorKeywords: Men who have Sex with Men
SubjectAreas: Public Health, Environmental and Occupational Health
